msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Leviticus 1
ab.l: And the divine Presence of the Lord called Moses, and spoke to him from the tent of meeting, saying,
‘Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, “If any man from you brings an offering to the Lord, you shall bring your offering of livestock from the cattle, and from the flock.
If his offering is a burnt offering from the cattle, he shall offer an unblemished male. He shall bring it to the door of the tent of meeting for his acceptance before the Lord.
And he shall reach out his hand over the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to ask for atonement for him.

And he shall slaughter the young of cattle before the Lord, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle
the blood on the altar, all around, that is at the door of the tent of meeting.
And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into pieces according to its pieces.
And the sons of Aaron, the priest, shall put fire on the altar, and lay the wood in order on the fire.

And Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall arrange the parts, the head, and
the neck in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar.
And he wash with water its entrails and its knees. And the priest shall burn all on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.
And if his offering is from the flock, from the lambs or from the goats, for a burnt offering, he shall bring an unblemished male.
And he shall slaughter it on the northward side of the altar before the Lord, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood on the altar, all around.
And he shall cut it into pieces according to its pieces, its head, and its neck, and the priest shall arrange them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar.
And he shall wash the entrails and the knees with water. And the priest shall bring it all and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.
And if his offering to the Lord is a burnt offering of birds, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves or of young pigeons.
And the priest shall bring it to the altar, and wring off its head, and burn it on the altar, and the blood thereof shall be drained out on the side of the altar.

And he shall remove away its crop
with its feathers, and he shall cast it beside the altar eastward to the place of the ashes.

And he shall halve it by its wings, but shall not divide it. And the priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.

app.note: K: shave; a scribal error (or a mistranslation), cf. Heb. וּמָלַק ‘and wring off’.
